job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: pstrongJOIN USstrongppbrppSymphony RetailAI is the global leader in artificial intelligenceenabled solutions for FMCG retailers and CPG manufacturers From customer intelligence to personalized marketing and merchandising and category management to supply chain and retail operations This is an exciting time to join a fast moving high growth Company Our team share a passion for retail data and technology  we love to celebrate success and wed like you to join us on our exciting journey We offer fantastic benefits including flexible working policies summer working hours and the chance to have some fun with your colleaguesppbrppCheck us out here and hear from our Chairman and CEO about why retailers and CPG choose us as well as find out more about us ppbrppstrongTHE OPPORTUNITYstrongppThis Data Scientist will be part of a team that leverages AI to solve business challenges faced by our clients In particular this team will be focused on developing algorithms and models to uncover opportunities and support client decisionmaking related to promotions advertising vendor negotiations and assortments We gauge success based on actionable insights that result in measurable business value thus the ability to turn diagnostic and predictive analytics into prescriptive insight is vital to success of the rolenbspppbrppWe are looking for a creative and curious problem solver who is passionate about data science We have a team culture that encourages innovation expects a high level of ownership and takes pride in what we doppbrppbrppstrongKEY ACTIVITIESstrongppApply analytical techniques to identify actionable insightsppUnderstand a business need expressed by a client or client team member and think creatively to identify opportunities to solve their pain points or strategic questionsppDetermine the types of data necessary and the optimal AI  statistical technique to derive actionable insightsppPresent and explain outcomes to client team members iterating as neededppCollaborate with product RampD to translate and deploy proven models into future CINDE releasesppbrppstrongKEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREDstrongppBachelors Degree in Math Computer Science Computer Engineering or a related field is requiredppGood knowledge of databases as well as relevant programming skills  eg R Python ppUnderstanding how algorithms work learning methods supervised semisupervised unsupervised reinforced decision trees neural networks statistical algorithmsppStrong demonstrable problemsolving skillsppAbility to clearly communicate technical content to business people using words and visualizationsppSelfstarter who likes to work independently and with groups to achieve optimal performanceppEnjoys working in a dynamic work environmentppMust be detail and quality orientedppbrppstrongemWe will be over the moon if you also haveemstrongppa Masters  MBAppExperience working with customer centric data  loyalty datappExperience leveraging data and analytics for category management  merchandising decision makingp
